TopicTitle: Quick question about distinction between RCS and engines.

Articles.Content:
Do I get this right, I can't just turn one nozzle of an RCS block into an engine using config files because I'd have to add thrustTransform transform(or whatever, later named in thrustVectorTransformNam﻿e) to the model in Unity?
I know I can bind throttle control to RCS in game, but that's all based on the ModuleRCSFXand doesn't actually give me an "engine" (ModuleEnginesFX).

Just tried this out - pasted the T-30 engine module section into the stock RCS and was able to launch by setting the ModuleEngine thrustTransforn to the RCS thrust transform name. I did notice the RCS seemed to be messed up as a roll maneuver triggered two(?) of the RCS to fire in a roll direction and the other two to fire incorrectly. I'm guessing the ModuleEngine picks the first transform of the given name.
